definition: Lincoln (name)/Abraham Lincoln (1809-1865), US president 1861-1865/Lincoln, US car make
woods/forest/CL:片[pian4]/circle(s) (i.e. specific group of people)/a collection (of similar things)
to agree/to consent/to be ready (to do sth)/willing

sentences.english: Lincoln, in contrast, is sui generis.
sentences.chinese: 相反，林肯則是獨一無二的。

sentences.english: Lincoln said he understood the man's sorrow.
sentences.chinese: 林肯坦言，他理解老人的喪子之痛。

sentences.english: Lincoln's Birthday is commemorated every year in his hometown of Hodgenville.
sentences.chinese: 林肯紀念日每年都會在他的故鄉霍金維爾被慶祝。

sentences.english: The great man Abraham Lincoln was once a poor boy with little education.
sentences.chinese: 偉人林肯就曾經是個受教育不多的窮孩子。

sentences.english: In 1860, Lincoln became President of the United States.
sentences.chinese: 在一八六四年，林肯成爲美國總統。

sentences.english: As the map indicates, the Lincoln Park is one of the scenic spots.
sentences.chinese: 按地圖上所標明的，林肯公園是風景點之一。

sentences.english: This opposition in the cabinet caused Lincoln to postpone action on the Fox plan.
sentences.chinese: 由於內閣成員的反對導致林肯推遲了實施福克斯計劃。

sentences.english: When Lincoln and Sucre arrive at the pier, Gretchen and Self are gone.
sentences.chinese: 林肯和蘇克雷趕到碼頭，格雷琴和賽爾夫已經離開了。

sentences.english: INSTANCE】Lincoln is an instance of a poor boy who becames famous.
sentences.chinese: 林肯是一個由窮孩子變成名人的例子。

sentences.english: Lincoln was very surprised, but he pretended to be calm.
sentences.chinese: 林肯非常驚訝，但是他假裝鎮靜自若。

sentences.english: She had always said how lucky she was to have been able to lose her Lincolnshire accent.
sentences.chinese: 她常常談到爲能改掉林肯郡口音感到高興。

sentences.english: Eiko in "Water, " created for Lincoln Center Out of Doors.
sentences.chinese: 永子在《水》中，爲林肯中心戶外節表演所作。

sentences.english: Lincoln calls Gretchen and fills her in on Self's double-cross.
sentences.chinese: 林肯格打給格雷琴，將賽爾夫的出賣告訴了她。

sentences.english: The steam was shut off, and the Abraham Lincoln, beating to port, described a semicircle.
sentences.chinese: 汽門立刻被關掉了，林肯號從左舷轉了一百八十度。

sentences.english: Bink only found herself back home in Lincolnshire five times in 2008.
sentences.chinese: Bink發現自己在2008年回了林肯郡的家五次。

sentences.english: One of his friends, Howells called him "Lincoln of our literature" and a literary critic, H. L.
sentences.chinese: 他的朋友豪威爾斯稱他爲“我們文學中的林肯”。

definition: Škoda, Czech Republic car manufacturer, a subsidiary of Volkswagen Group

pinyin: Tong1 yong4 Qi4 che1 Gong1 si1
